title: Saag Paneer Pilau
optional_ingredients: 6 large free-range eggs, at room temperature
instructions: Heat ghee in a large non-stick pan with a lid. Add cumin seeds and let them bubble for 1 minute.
Add garlic and onion; cook over medium-high heat for 5 minutes until golden.
Add paneer and cook for 2–3 minutes until golden.
Blend spinach with a splash of water to make a paste. Add to the pan with lemon juice and salt. Cook until dry.
Add rice and cook for 1–2 minutes until the grains brighten slightly.
Pour in hot water and bring to a boil. Once the water reduces and rice is visible (about 5 minutes), reduce heat to low, cover, and steam for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, soft-boil the eggs for 6 minutes.
After 30 minutes, uncover the pilau and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Serve with halved soft-boiled eggs and pickled red cabbage, if using.
notes: Traditionally saag paneer is a curry, but this version incorporates rice for a one-pot meal.
A blender is required to make the spinach paste.
author: Nadiya Hussain
